diagnosis.score_summary: Overall alignment is a respectable 70/100, but this score masks a deep identity crisis. While foundational elements like Purpose and Messaging are consistent, the brand's core Values, Personality (Archetypes), and Positioning are schizophrenic. These 5 critical gaps create two different brands: a charming artisan on WWW and a serious, premium contender on PDP.

truth_1.headline: Folksy Story vs. Spec Sheet
truth_1.gap_description: The WWW values 'Heritage & Craft,' building trust through a personal, folksy origin story. The PDP values 'Safety First,' building trust by presenting a clean, simple ingredient list as a data-driven guarantee. One sells a narrative, the other sells a formula.
truth_1.evidence: [VALUES] WWW: 'Heritage & Craft' — 'our handcrafted natural soaps are made the old fashion way' vs. PDP: 'Safety First' — 'say good-bye to chemical filled moisturizers'
truth_1.why_matters: This conflict confuses the customer about what they're paying for: a charming story or a safe formula. It creates a perceived value gap, making it difficult to defend a premium price when the brand can't decide if its authority comes from a kitchen or a lab.
truth_1.the_hard_choice: Your brand's soul is torn between its past and its future. The data suggests the market values the clinical safety of the PDP. Option A: Commit to 'Safety First' by professionalizing the website, replacing the origin story with data-driven proof of purity. Option B: Commit to 'Heritage & Craft' by injecting the personal, handmade narrative into the PDP to justify its artisanal price. You are either a charming storyteller or a trusted scientist; you cannot be both.

truth_2.headline: The Mother vs. The Monk
truth_2.gap_description: The brand has a split personality. The WWW is a nurturing 'Caregiver,' promising to protect and comfort sensitive skin. The PDP is a pure 'Innocent,' promising a return to natural simplicity and an escape from corrupt 'chemicals.' One is a hug, the other is a principle.
truth_2.evidence: [ARCHETYPES MIX] WWW Primary: 'The Caregiver' — 'custom made for sensitive dry skin' vs. PDP Primary: 'The Innocent' — 'Say good-bye to chemical filled moisturizers'
truth_2.why_matters: A customer can't form a relationship with a brand that has two different personalities. This inconsistency makes the brand feel inauthentic and opportunistic. Is the goal to nurture me or to purify me? The conflicting motivations erode trust.
truth_2.the_hard_choice: The direct, simple promise of 'The Innocent' is likely driving conversions on the hyper-competitive Amazon shelf. You must decide on a single personality. Option A: Embrace 'The Innocent' globally, simplifying the website's message to focus on purity above all else. Option B: Discipline the PDP to reflect the nurturing 'Caregiver' archetype, adding warmth and emotional connection at the risk of losing clarity. A brand needs one soul, not two.

truth_3.headline: Daily Staple vs. Investment Piece
truth_3.gap_description: On its website, the brand positions itself as 'The Gentle Giant,' a high-quality but accessible 'Daily Essential.' On Amazon, it acts as 'The Clean Essentialist,' a premium 'Investment Piece' for discerning consumers. One is an upgrade for your routine; the other is a statement about your lifestyle.
truth_3.evidence: [POSITIONING] WWW Value Perception: 'Daily Essential (2/5)' vs. PDP Value Perception: 'Investment Piece (4/5)'
truth_3.why_matters: This positioning conflict creates price friction. When a customer sees a folksy 'Daily Essential' on the website, the premium price on Amazon feels like a markup. When they see a premium 'Investment Piece' on Amazon, the simple website can make the brand feel cheap and untrustworthy.
truth_3.the_hard_choice: Your Amazon success suggests the market will bear a more premium positioning. You are at a crossroads between volume and value. Option A: Elevate the entire brand to match the 'Investment Piece' reality of the PDP, redesigning the website to feel more premium and exclusive. Option B: Align all channels to the accessible 'Daily Essential' strategy, potentially adjusting price to own the 'best-in-class staple' position. You can't be a bargain and a luxury at the same time.

truth_4.headline: The Story Is Getting Serious
truth_4.gap_description: While both channels use a 'Gentle Guide' tone, a subtle but critical evolution is happening. The PDP is more serious and professional (Humor 2/5) than the website, which retains a folksier, more conversational feel (Humor 3/5, Formality 4/5). The brand is becoming more clinical where it competes most fiercely.
truth_4.evidence: [TONE OF VOICE] Humor Slider: WWW 3/5 vs. PDP 2/5. Formality Slider: WWW 4/5 vs. PDP 3/5.
truth_4.why_matters: This drift is a hidden risk because it suggests the brand's original, charming voice is a liability in a high-stakes commercial environment. The market may be rewarding professionalism over personality, and the brand is unconsciously adapting. If left unchecked, the brand's authentic soul will be silently eroded by marketplace pressures.
truth_4.the_hard_choice: Your Amazon channel is a real-time focus group, and it's telling you that a more serious tone sells. You must make a conscious choice about your voice. Option A: Re-inject the brand's original, humorous personality into the PDP to protect its authentic soul at all costs. Option B: Formally adopt the more professional, serious tone from Amazon across all channels, acknowledging that the brand has matured beyond its origin story. You must decide if you want to be a charming founder or a category king.

truth_5.headline: Nature's Authority Is Undisputed
truth_5.gap_description: The brand's purpose as 'The Harmonizer' is perfectly consistent, providing a rock-solid foundation. However, the PDP executes this with far more confidence and clarity, using direct language like 'nature's intended skincare.' The website communicates the same purpose, but buries it within a longer, less direct personal narrative.
truth_5.evidence: [PURPOSE] Both channels: 'The Harmonizer'. PDP execution is bolder: 'say hello to nature's intended skincare.'
truth_5.why_matters: This perfect alignment proves the brand's core idea is powerful and resonant. The PDP's success demonstrates that the market is ready for a more direct, confident expression of this purpose. Your own website is the conservative bottleneck, holding back the brand's most powerful message.
truth_5.the_hard_choice: You have found your brand's true north, but only one channel is pointing directly at it. The choice is about confidence. Option A: Preserve the softer, story-led approach on the website, keeping the purpose as a subtle undercurrent. Option B: Adopt the PDP's bold, declarative language across all channels, sharpening your core message because you know it works. The market has already validated your strongest claim; it's time to make it everywhere.

marker_1.so_what: The brand's core 'why' is perfectly consistent, providing a powerful and stable foundation for all communication.

marker_2.so_what: A perfectly aligned mission ensures that both channels are working towards the same strategic goal, building coherent brand equity.

marker_3.so_what: This profound values conflict (Story vs. Safety) creates deep strategic confusion and undermines the brand's authenticity.

marker_4.so_what: A schizophrenic positioning (Staple vs. Luxury) creates price sensitivity and confuses customers about the product's true value.

marker_5.so_what: While both channels project a 'Trusted Friend,' the PDP version is less effusive and more authoritative, hinting at a brand in transition.

marker_6.so_what: The brand has a split personality, showing up as a nurturing 'Caregiver' on WWW and a pure 'Innocent' on PDP, which destroys authenticity.

marker_7.so_what: A highly consistent 'Gentle Guide' tone creates a reliable and trustworthy user experience across channels.

marker_8.so_what: The PDP's visual execution is warmer and more structured, suggesting a more professional and confident evolution of the 'Earthy Organic' look.

marker_9.so_what: Perfectly consistent 'Alchemist' messaging ensures the brand tells a single, compelling story about its ingredients on every channel.

marker_10.so_what: A consistent 'Ritual' narrative reinforces the brand's story of a visionary founder using pure, harvested ingredients.

marker_11.so_what: The PDP leans much more heavily on social proof ('The Fans') for validation, a clear adaptation to the Amazon review-driven ecosystem.

marker_12.so_what: The brand is a niche 'Specialist' on its site but a broader 'Ingredient King' on Amazon, creating confusion about its market ambition and focus.

marker_13.so_what: A consistent focus on 'Science Education' (or Nature Education) builds trust and authority effectively across all customer touchpoints.

marker_14.so_what: The promise of 'Restoration' is clear and consistent, ensuring customers understand the core functional job the product is hired to do.

marker_15.so_what: A consistent emotional promise of 'Relief / Safety' creates a powerful and reliable sense of trust for customers with sensitive skin.

marker_16.so_what: The customer's motivation for buying is different: a smart, 'insider' choice on WWW versus a bolder 'statement' on PDP.

marker_17.so_what: The brand offers membership to two different tribes: 'Ethical Warriors' on WWW and a 'Knowledge Club' on PDP, fragmenting its community.
